column4: I've managed to mess up my firefox, so that I have to type "firefox.ubuntu" to make it start. Is there a way I can do a total reinstall of FF with all Ubuntu integration?
user synaptics and mark firefox for 'complete removal' and thn instal it again

didn't do it. After completely removing everything and then reinstalling, I still don't have the "firefox" command. All I have is firefox-3.0 and firefox.ubuntu (which I know is the same app). The problem is that stuff like choosing an app to open a downloaded file with doesn't work anymore, so something fundamental must have been broken...
for firefox, you should use install old,stable firefox2 in repositories
